headline: RH, Other Furniture Stocks Fall After Trump’s New Tariffs
summary: Home goods retailers largely fell after President Trump unveiled new tariffs on kitchen cabinets, upholstered furniture and bathroom vanities.  The levies include 50% duties on kitchen cabinets and 30% on upholstered furniture.  "The reason for this is the large-scale 'FLOODING' of these products into the United States," Trump said on Truth Social, adding that U.S. manufacturing needed to be protected on national-security grounds.

headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: GlobalFoundries, Oracle, Intel, Paccar
summary: ↘️ Williams-Sonoma (WSM), RH (RH): President Trump announced new tariffs on imported items such as kitchen cabinets and upholstered furniture, to start next week. Shares of furniture and home-goods retailers were mixed, with Williams-Sonoma edging higher and RH falling 4.

headline: Furniture, Household Goods Stocks Shake Off Trump's New Tariffs
summary: Home-good retailers shook off President Trump's unveiling of new tariffs on kitchen cabinets, upholstered furniture and bathroom vanities.  The levies include 50% duties on kitchen cabinets and 30% on upholstered furniture.  "The reason for this is the large-scale 'FLOODING' of these products into the United States," Trump said on Truth Social, adding that U.S. manufacturing needed to be protected on national-security grounds.

headline: August PCE, Trump tariffs, US chip policy: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are moving higher after August's Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index — the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation gauge — came in line with forecasts, holding at 2.9% month-over-month. The Trump administration plans to impose new tariffs on furniture imports, a 100% tariff on drugmakers who manufacture outside the US, and 25% tariffs on heavy trucks. According to Wall Street Journal reporting, the US is also planning a "1-to-1" chip production rule in a move to curb overseas reliance on semiconductor manufacturing. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Trump's new tariffs hit Wayfair, Williams-Sonoma shares; La-Z-Boy gains
summary: (Reuters) -Shares of retailers Williams-Sonoma and Wayfair, fell on Friday after President Donald Trump unveiled tariffs on furniture imports, while those of La-Z-Boy and Ethan Allen, which manufacture largely in the U.S., gained.  As part of his latest tariff onslaught, Trump announced a 50% tariff on imported kitchen cabinets and vanities, along with a 30% levy on upholstered furniture, which are set to take effect on October 1.

headline: 1 Consumer Stock to Target This Week and 2 We Find Risky
summary: Retailers are overhauling their operations as technology redefines the shopping experience. This includes developing an online presence to fend off e-commerce competitors, a strategy that has helped the industry maintain steady demand by giving it more sales channels. In turn, retail stocks were up 16.5% over the past six months, on par with the S&P 500.
